page.title: 06CROOKHAM : HEALTH
page.content: There are no medical facilities in Crookham Village itself. The local dentists are in Fleet. The doctors' surgeries are at Fleet or neighbouring Crondall. Hospital treatment can be given either in the local hospital at Fleet or in the district hospital at Frimley Park. In 1985 the Fleet hospital is under threat of closure because of cuts in the NHS budget. The local populace object to this a) because Frimley Park is already over-used. Having been planned before the mass in-migration to this part of Hampshire, it was designed to serve a population of 190,000. The population is now 250,000 and growing. b) because the cost per patient in this health region is already the lowest in the country and they feel it is wrong to penalise an area that has proved its efficiency.A decision is awaited.
